title: Writing Complete Sentences

vocab.definition: A group of words that tells a whole thought and makes sense
Who or what the sentence is about
What the subject does or is
Marks like periods and question marks that help us read sentences

teachingNotes: Start with simple subject-predicate combinations. Use picture prompts and guided practice. Focus on complete thoughts and proper punctuation.

sample.question: Turn these words into a complete sentence: dog, runs, the
expectedAny: complete sentence with subject and predicate

truefalse.question: A complete sentence needs both a subject and a predicate.
expectedAny: sentences need who/what and what they do

fillintheblank.question: In the sentence 'Birds fly high,' the subject is _____ and the predicate is _____.
